pKxSZdOIHcKCDz31jpdVew.text: This was a horrible experience! We were excited to try the Impossible Burger. Advertising on the table made it even more. After ordering we were informed they were out of Impossible Burgers. We then chose a chicken substitute. Unfortunately it was overcooked and stringy. That was ok we understood that. UNTIL they charged us for both the Impossible Burgers AND the chicken. We did not realize the error until we got home. ( Just wanted to get out if there). When we called they apologized. Manager was supposed to take off bill. Server or manager did not catch that! BTW get some napkins. Paper towels don't cut it! NEVER AGAIN!

_bLoSqAeAn42W_Nfgh1Uew.text: I never had anything I did not like.  The only hamburgers I like are at Red Robin.  Diane and Scott are great servers.  I recently had lunch and my debit card would not work because of a fraud alert.  Scott trusted me to go home and call in another credit card.  Great Customer Service!

6i8E1hafGRcKk-vh6ZVE5A.text: They have seriously gone down hill in the last year or so. I used to be a fan, liked their burgers and several other items, and prices were reasonable. Prices are still OK, but quality has taken a serious nose-dive - burgers are smaller/thinner and not as juicy or flavorful. They seem to be short-staffed both in the kitchen and at the tables. Won't be going back anytime soon.

rr0YKhsjFlyGEIVhooY4HQ.text: The food is pretty good for a more affordable price. The burgers are good and my waiter was very nice and helpful.  My issue with this restaurant was the noise level. There was a younger waitress who spoke very loudly. She was having a conversation with other staff across the restaurant, but it was late at night so I figured it's probably the end of her shift and she's tired. Until: she began arguing(?) with an older waitress in the back of the dining room. I'm not sure if it was arguing or just a very fast paced conversation, but it was so loud that I could hardly hear the person I was dining with. Had the waitress been less disruptive I definitely would've given 4 stars, but the most important part of dining is being able to talk with your table and I couldn't do that.

RXvQPb5HsFcjMA_z6gByyw.text: This review would be five stars except for the fact that it always takes longer for the next basket of bottomless fries to come out. Pretty standard Red Robin experience. They currently have a promotion of two bottom less sides with burger purchase. I got the fries, obviously, and coleslaw. My friend didn't like the coleslaw but I thought it was pretty good. You need to get the campfire sauce for your fries.

T_Nc52aZRbzLXoHJh_yTcw.text: We came to Red Robin for my birthday dinner and it wasn't bad...wasn't great, but wasn't bad. I've been to the Cranberry location before so I figured this would be about the same experience but it definitely wasn't. We had about a 15 minute wait when we got there and then we were seated in the almost empty bar area, there were about 20 tables and only 2 had customers at them so I really don't understand why there was a wait at all but whatever. After another 10 minuets the waitress finally came and took our drink order, she seemed a little rushed but she brought the drinks back quickly and took our order. Our food took a while coming out but when it finally did everything was right and the burgers were really good, the fries were pretty soggy and there were seriously maybe 10 on the plate. I don't understand what the point of calling it bottomless fries if they barely give you any and then act like you're asking for a kidney when you need more. The waitress didn't come back and check on us until we were both done eating and since we were both still kinda hungry we both asked for more fries and she brought us back one basket with maybe 10 more fries in it for us to share, thanks. The burgers and my Oreo shake were both really good but the bad service and less than generous portions of cold fries made the trip not worth it at all. I'll probably go to Red Robin again, just not this one.

0njDhN8Ydcv7P30xzWQzAw.text: I'm writing this as a review to my future self...  Hi Future Self,  This is Past Self. Did you just drive into the Red Robin parking lot? Then turn around and find somewhere else for your meal. "It's convenient," you might say. Or "everywhere else has a longer wait." Don't let this discourage you, you CAN have a way better experience somewhere else.  You will undoubtedly walk in and wait at least a few minutes, only to be brought to a table that is either unclean, missing utensils, or something else. The wait staff will arrive only to provide poor service or forget about you all together and you will need to go in search of a team member or manager to help you in another part of the restaurant.  When you finally receive your food you will be underwhelmed and left empty, sad that you ultimately did decide to have your meal here. "It's really not that great," "I don't know why we came here," you'll say to yourself.  Future Self--I implore you, go somewhere else and get lured in by the bottomless fries.  Best Regards, Past Self

Vhf5_-YftMH7_Hm9AJEJ4Q.text: Horrible service. We sat for almost 10 minutes before we saw a server. We hit the call button on the ziosk and still waited for a server for 5 minutes. Sever herself was fine, but the hostess was rude and the manager was a coward.

d2KWrpxwkYyEAr5ZU_9Tdw.text: I'm not a fan. I'm am so happy that they provide gluten free buns. Beyond that I'm not happy with the products or service. Ordering from an iPad -esque screen  does not provide the initial relationship with the server. I had to raise my hand for a drink. I'm not an obnoxious customer, I promise! It's just that I need a drink! Isn't that server 101? There were so many people standing around tonight (not getting me a drink). The fries are never ending but the servers don't ask if you want more. This is due to the iPad-esque ordering screen. You'd think with this assistant that they would be able to free up some time. But honestly, who wants frozen steak fries?

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States

LTeBTzwr5vZEyDbMUWucVg.text: This has got to be the worst experience I've ever had a restaurant. My waitress started off pretty good, but that changed very quickly. After getting our drink, Kerri, the waitress, disappeared. So our food showed up 20 minutes later, my son ordered a plain cheeseburger with bottomless fries, which was OK. However, my grilled chicken Cobb salad was absolutely disgusting.  I have no idea what the chicken was made of but there's no way this stuff was chicken! It was hard and inedible, but still white like grilled chicken. I couldn't bite into it or chew it. I asked to see the manager about it , he showed up 15 minutes later and tried to convince me that there was nothing wrong with it. He insisted on bringing me another salad, however, at that point, I didn't want it..  He finally agreed to just take that horrible mess away and take it off my check. But the pain doesn't stop there!  I ended up paying  $15 for a plain cheeseburger  and fries for my 12 year old! Never again! I've always like Red Robin, but this experience, has definitely cured me. Red Robin you SUCK!!! I will eat at McDonald's before I eat here again. If I could give them a 1/2 star or better yet, NO STAR at all, I would.

z4vq8dy2jnbhPW8Qa5fKMg.text: The place wasn't busy at all and it took forever to even get seated. Our server was scarce and the entire process took forever. I was not impressed with my burger, but couldn't tell anyone because our server was scarce.

ZiTz3_PaTJSLzHu5uiK7lg.text: Well went there on a Sunday evening are waitress Shelley was nowhere to be found at first we sat there for 10 minutes than she greeted us than we waiting 10 minutes for our  drink order so waiting for our drinks turn on the waitress light on 5 minute later she came we kept seeing her sit at a table talking when everyone around us was being sitted and taken care of before us after us being there longer i have never had a bad experience at red robin till tonight

vAt_2rQ8X14yAFpXITs47w.text: FIVE STARS plus plus plus goes to our server Cassidy! TEN STARS are still not nearly enough.  Cassidy was beyond excellent!!!!   Our dinner consisted of 15 people during a very busy Friday night dinner rush.  Cassidy greeted every one of us with her warm personality and beautiful smile.  She immediately got our drinks and got all of our drinks and food orders 100% right. This can be a challenge for a large crowd, but Cassidy was so professional and cheerful the entire time while we were all there.  Cassidy also kept all the refills on all of are drinks and fries without anybody asking.  Thank you so much Cassidy!!!  Also kudos goes out to the cooks in the kitchen. All of our meals were excellent in taste, temperature and excellent timing.  Not one problem at all.

4Y4DzKt61wE6kYGZ1M7YVw.text: This chain has quite the assortment of burgers and sandwiches. I signed up for their birthday club and I rarely come here outside of my birthday month when I receive a free burger. Their "bottomless fries" make for quite the challenge and it's fun to see just how many servings you can get through.  The only problem is that I've always had an issue with the servers coming back in a timely manner, so I rarely get my fill of fries before I reach the limits of my patience.   They're making an effort to modernize their restaurant, so many functions such as ordering drinks, ordering appetizers, and paying for the tab can be done from a tablet posted at the table. This feels very impersonal at times and I would prefer to stick to the old-fashioned way of doing things but I can appreciate the attempt.   With the many options here, I've been able to try something different each time and I've always been satisfied. Their drinks seems overpriced in relation to their food pricing, but I assume they have to make their money somehow.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States. Like their fries, their containers are bottomless too!

ctgTVKCqHSA-sfRAZMgRbw.text: I love this location! Always have excellent service and wonderful food! Today, the chef brought me free shrimp because she didn't like how the first batch came out, although I thought they were great! I'll take extras anytime!

9d-tL6QxfBgBMIPT1JkPVw.text: Pretty good Red Robin. I've been here twice. 8 I've had a burger and a Cobb salad. The Cobb salad is my favorite in Pittsburgh so far. The burger was good. Had to wait a bit.   My biggest complaint is they do not take reservations. Additionally, the fries associated with bottomless fries are sparse. Two servings here is equivalent to one serving elsewhere.

wyXlgYmUDHPEFMWxZZYV1A.text: Upon arrival we were told there was a 10 minute wait, I could see many open tables which was a bit irritating. Our server Sam was nice, he was definitely busy. One of my pet peeves is when they bring our food without giving you time to eat your appetizer or salad. This practice irritates me to the point that I ask if I should hold my order back so we have time to enjoy our app/salad...the food came 2 onion rings in. So I'd suggest holding back your food order if you are getting an app. The haystack burger was tasty and done correctly my bun was stale and hard which was surprising considering burgers are what they do here. The fries were good and their ranch was very good as well. With so many other dining options in the area and based on the underwhelming greeting, the unnecessary wait along with the dried out burger bun I probably won't go out of my way to stop back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States. Short stack Towering Onion Rings
Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States. Haystack Tavern Double Burger
Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States. Bacon Cheeseburger

ab3FeZadFc6grtI6kjmWEg.text: Another great visit to Red Robin.  I am embarrassed to say, but my boyfriend and I have started going out to eat on Sunday afternoons. The wait times are nonexistent, the food arrives quickly, its quieter, and yes.. were officially an old married couple.   When you take all of these factors out of the picture (wait time, service, noise, etc), it allows you to focus your reviews more on the food itself.   My boyfriend gave his burger 5 stars.  Me, on the other hand, gave my salad a 3 out of 5. Once I got through the chicken there was nothing but lettuce.   Overall score, 4/5.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States
Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States

bGQPVmKbpFefeBHKT4OUkA.text: Went on a Saturday when they weren't too busy. Was seated right away and our waitress was very attentive to my table throughout the meal. The food was ok, not the best burger I've ever had. I give it 3 stars though because afterwards, the food didn't sit well in my friend's and I's stomach. Overall, good food but I'm not sure I'd go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States

shd7keUVlqFhZQIoHs1Vow.text: We waited for several minutes at the front before an employee showed up. She told us that the wait was an additional 10 minutes, so we waited near the entrance. When she called our name, we saw many empty tables available, so I assume that they were short on waiters. The waitress was nice and performed her job well, bringing us our food and drink refills promptly. We enjoyed the taste of the nachos, burger, and chicken salad.

dzEppjmGerOAGRWvt1hOyg.text: What can I say, I love Red Robin. It's cheap, it's good, and where else do you get unlimited fries? and don't even get me started on those dipping sauces. Campfire? to die for. Ranch? the creamiest. Garlic aioli? Talk about mouth watering.   Call me crazy but Res Robin could get it.

602S8-HThAXt7ibcfAknCQ.text: Red Robin has two steps of burgers, the regular with a price range around $11.50 and a gourmet menu with prices around $14:50. I don't think the few additions on the gourmet burgers make it worth  the price.   I ordered one burger and a different one came out. Our waitress said she input the wrong burger. She offered to bring me what I ordered, but my timeline didn't allow for this.   The guy beside me ordered the fried fish and it looked awesome. If you go to Red Robin and don't want a burger, this looks like it might be a great alternative.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States

Y-zpRG68N5LPIQxmXT04fg.text: We had our grandkids with us today. I wasn't impressed with the food today. Service was great, quick and attentive. The kids enjoyed the food so they said. I didn't like the burger, it's my fault I should have asked for some pink, it was burnt and taste rough. I also should have asked for no relish , I love pickles that was great, but the relish kinda spoiled it for me.  The baby's chicken on a stick was burnt as well and had trouble finding pieces to feed her, she Loved the fries ! My grandson loved the kids Mac-cheese.  I am not sure I will return

RTSD97qQeg_U63VvPzMIFg.text: Went to Red Robin last night after work for a quick dinner. When we arrived there was a wait and were told it would be about 10 minutes but we probably only waited about 5 minutes which was really nice. We both ordered burgers, of course. I feel like you have to get one when you go. The promotion at the time was that you get two endless sides with a burger or an entree, so that was an added bonus. We also shared the soft pretzels as an appetizer which came with a delicious beer cheese. It was so good I honestly could've eaten it just by itself. Our burgers were cooked perfectly too and were very tasty. Overall, pretty solid experience and fast service!!!

u1SJsK_FXBfh5dQR8WKX_A.text: Ugh. One of the worst experiences I've ever had!!!   We sat and waited for about a half an hour before anyone acknowledged us. We were told it was because of new and young employees and lack of communication. Yeah ok.   The following service was random and inconsistent.  The manager tried to make jokes about it. We got a free app. Not worth it.  I even told the front desk how unhappy we were but, whatever. I got attitude there as well.   We tipped 10% due to how crappy everything was, then proceeded to get yelled at by a server we had never seen, f*ck you, we share tips here!   Never again.

vrXCBuRm80OfFkn3zy2rwA.text: Significant improvement from the last time we came here. Started out with a short stack of onion rings and ordered a couple salads. The onion rings come with a delicious, tangy Carolina BBQ sauce that is a must try. I ordered the Southwest Sombrero salad, a fancy Mexican Cobb salad and my date ordered a crispy chicken salad. It was better than expected to be honest.   I gave it four stars because it was good food for the value, subtotal right around $25. Looking for a decent burger (or salad) joint with no frills, look no further. Red Robin is your place to go.

S4yQEMU8VHKf95JAfGSoWw.text: I haven't had a bad experience at this location and they have an allergy menu, my servers are always very nice and work with my egg allergy. Thank you.

basEIDinOxpnLWM22AXw3w.text: Shame on Red Robin Waterfront Location in Homestead Pennsylvania.   The way your management treats their high school employees.  My daughter is graduating this year and went away on a JROTC field trip and as soon as she came back from the trip she tried repeatedly to get back on the schedule to work and was denied..many multiple excuses..managers are too busy to take a few minutes to talk to their employee. It's been 3 weeks since she has been back from her trip and still ignored.  Then a meeting was set up only to be blown off again by this manager not being there for an emergency...thanks for a phone call.  Parents and potential people thinking about working at Red Robin Waterfront in Homestead BEWARE! To the management team..if you have kids.. shame on you for how you treated our daughter as an employee.

pf2_gVQ0VdGF_uAprbkUAg.text: Do not eat here incompetent staff, dirty bathrooms, standing water in the restroom, cold facets only, I questioned how clean the restaurant was,  food sub par & pricey "WILL NEVER EAT AT A RED ROBIN" I am actually ill

fb1lVYf-zk_FUeRggTgTWA.text: Service was good, Wales in and got sat right away. However the resturant is dirty, food and garbage all over the floor. The burger was not great either. Their decision to ask pink no pink I get makes it easy. However neither burger should have burned edges. I mean burned. It wasn't very good. They are cooking fries so fast they aren't letting them cook completely. Our fries were mushy, and not good. I would recommend the other Red Robin in south hills village mall. It's much better.

MRv2Pu75PenScZE1fHLVZw.text: My friend was in from out of town and her daughter was craving burgers - with her love of fries - we decided to head to Red Robin since they have endless fries. Big mistake - we could have gotten better food at McDonalds.  The problems started when we walked in the door.  The hostess asked us to wait while she checked on a table.  While we waited 2 other groups walked in and got seated by other hostess.  Finally one of them asked if we needed a table.  We told them a hostess hadn't returned.  She said "Yeah she disappears".  She seated us.  Our table was a mess when we were seated.  My seat had crumbs all over it - as did the table.  No effort was made to clean it off.  We were seated at the tables with the red seats.  Since the bottom of the tables have large round bottoms, the seats do not pull up close to the table.  So the 4 year old with us - was barely at the table.  At one point - she tried to push back and the whole seat went backwards, terrifying her.  Honestly she's lucky she didn't get hurt. Employees watched and walked past - not a single one helped - a couple even laughed!  (We told the manager about this at the end of our visit who said "well these seats are made for 14 and up"....then why were we seated there!?!)  My friend ordered her burger medium well.  I ordered mine medium rare.  When we finally got our burgers (Service was incredibly slow for a pretty empty restaurant)  My burger came out - if you can even call it a burger - it was well done.  The burger was smaller/thinner than mcdonalds.  My friends burger - was completely inedible it was burnt to a crisp. Even if you asked for a well done burger - you wouldn't have been able to eat this burger.  We also each had 5 french fries on our plate.  5.  Endless fries and they gave us FIVE.    We sent my friends burger back.  Then - it came back completely plain.  NOTHING on it - she was paying for a Gourmet burger - it didn't even have cheese.    The visit was a disaster.  I do not recommend.  Mcdonalds burgers are better and cheaper - just drive down the road and get McDonalds.

B5RBjS1ajcV2hdnKxt_wNg.text: I love Red Robin but this time the service was slow, my crescent bun was smashed and destroyed.  The fries were very stiff undercooked/ had that crunch a raw potato has. My daughters apples looked like someone had chewed them up.

q9n0HibaBtOBE1nvWj3J5A.text: This is the second time in a month our family had fresh food and great service. Our server Sam gave great service tonight. My Boys were starving due to running errands all day, and I inadvertently told the server. Sam brought them French fries over while their burgers were being cooked. I also received a small salad, while my chicken was being prepared. I had the Chicken Ensenada. It was cooked perfectly. The ice tea was good too. We will be back!!

R9JLuOAR-e7WHReitlU7mQ.text: I went on a Thursday afternoon between 4-5 so it wasn't very busy and I was able to sit on the bar side easily. Despite this, the service was very so-so.  They also had none of their back beer taps working so the selection was limited. The waiter only had myself and 2 others to take care of but even after a full conversation about salad and how I wanted that brought out first...I'm still waiting on it. My burger and fries were brought out very quickly and the waiter was quick to ask if I'd want more fries since they are bottomless.  The food was decent, nothing great. I can think of better places for a burger in my opinion but they do have a lot of variety here and decent prices. I tried the Fiery Ghost Tavern Burger and it had decent flavor/heat. The burger was very well done and I wasn't given an option on how I'd like it cooked. I'd have preferred it more medium but I digress. Overall, this will get the job done if you are looking for a quick bite to eat and a drink.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States. Ok beer selection
Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States. Fiery Ghost Tavern Burger

hDqO8EQ1siSFCgXNIuLsbg.text: The burgers here are great, they offer a variety of options, and each comes with bottomless fries! We came on a Saturday night, so it was pretty crowded and there was a decent wait. But my friend and I found seats at the bar no problem. I took a risk from my typical order and got the Burning Love Burger, a spicy jalapeno flavored cheeseburger with chipotle mayo, and was glad I did. The burger had a nice kick with the fried jalapeno slices and pepper jack cheese, but not too overwhelming. Service while sitting at the bar was not as attentive as a sit down table would be; however, we were checked in on enough to get a second round of fries. Make sure to sign up for their email list, you will receive a free burger on your birthday!

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States. Burning Love Burger

m47aXJb7P6Izy94Qi2SfHw.text: A chain burger place.   The burgers are pretty good actually.  Get the strawberry lemonade concoction they brew up.  It's really good.  It's just a standard good chain hamburger.  Service is always prompt and seldom is this place crowded.

v_6_yMFoufpnNHBagBlOAA.text: Chain hamburger joint.  Wide selection of burgers done well, accompanied by a basket of "endless" fries, and any burger can be replaced with a boca patty for a vegetarian option.  Actually, really really good burgers.  On the minus side, service seems to be hit or miss, and you're looking at an $8 hamburger, plus drinks.

cFSn7gzXbs5NoIBYXPqswA.text: My all-time favorite burger joint!   I don't like to eat burgers at McDonald's and Burger King, but Red Robin is an exception.   People say that the best part of the burger is the meat. I have to agree, but there is one more factor that I consider to call it not a good burger, but an AMAZING BURGER. That factor is the...bun. The bun has herbs that makes the bread taste so much better. Plus, it is neither dry no flaky. The bun is baked to perfection.   Did I mention that they have bottomless fries? You can have as much fries as you want. Woot!  Ladies and gentlemen, come here if you want to satisfy your burger craves. I recommend the guacamole burger and banzai burger.

VMQFQ5q5XmYj8jBQOMJdvQ.text: If you like non gourmet burgers not cooked to order, and bottomless cold French fries, then come on down!  Oh, stay clear of the guacamole, which looks and tastes more like the gunk in the filter of a pool than guacamole. To their credit, they did take half off of our bill after complaining. The waitress was very nice.

U1wd3Mc0T44IOAOPvx3gVQ.text: Horrible chain burger restaurant. Service is spotty and I completely disagree with the other comments that the burgers are good. I have been forced to eat here for work several times. It is not a good option considering the many good options in Pittsburgh for burgers.

HatbIOROi7TuhwoG3klxNw.text: Great service from Ron. Red Robin is our stand by food spot. This trip was better than most. The food is always good, but the service this trip put it over the top.  The burger is not the cheapest but compare the end product to other burger joints and it worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Red Robin Gourmet Burgers and Brews - Homestead, PA, United States

wZ3oZPrJTvn_hHJw6iqn0g.text: Burgers are pricey and nothing special and the fries have been both hot and cold depending upon the batch. Service isn't great either.

rHyqR6jZdv2r5V37egyf7Q.text: Oh Red Robin, where do I start?  It's not going to be with the long wait time and long line to get in -- no, I went on a Saturday night and that's to be expected at the Waterfront.    It's not going to be about the bar seating where the tables are crammed so closely together that the guy sitting next to us invited himself into our conversation.  (He was really quite friendly although it was a BIT awkward...)  No, no, no.  I'm going to complain about the poor, slow service, the cold food, and the lack of any type of regret or apology on the part of the restaurant staff.    We found a seat in the bar section of the restaurant and took a seat.  Our waitress took our drink orders promptly and our drinks came fairly quickly.  That's about where anything positive about the experience ended.  We both ordered burgers, nothing fancy, no special orders.  I am aware that it was busy and that this might have slowed things down a bit, but REALLY?  We waited 45 minutes from the time we ordered until our burgers arrived.  Where in the heck does it take 45 minutes to cook a burger and slap it on a bun?  After about 25 minutes, our waitress came by and asked if we needed anything and told us our food would be out soon.  10 minutes later, all of the tables around us (including TWO tables that were seated after we were) had been served and we still had no food.   My friend finally went and asked a manager what the holdup was and was told that he would look into it.  Another 10 minutes went by and he brought our food to our table (finally).  No explanation about why it took so long.  No apology.  By the time our food came, we were short on time and practically inhaled our burgers.  The burgers were cool and tasteless -- now maybe we felt they were tasteless because we had to eat so fast that it was like we couldn't even enjoy them...   You would expect that after waiting 45 minutes for a burger and fries that the least they could do is serve it warm...  We didn't end up paying for the burgers, they took them off our check after we complained a second time.  But no one apologized, seemed sorry in the slightest.  I would much rather have paid for my burger and had it arrive warm and promptly...  So.  Red Robin, even in the face of a free burger, you still stink.  I won't be returning.

xSqMidAGrZ-J8jUfl-ZLlw.text: This is the one of the only restaurants we go to that my kids like and at which I also feel satisfied eating.  My five and seven year olds love it here.  The burgers are very tasty with a lot of variety.  But more importantly they also offer salads and other good healthy alternatives like vegetarian and turkey burgers.  And they taste good!  You can also get fruit salad instead of fries.  It is a clean, attractive place with what appears to be a full bar (though I haven't partaken of the alcohol here myself.)  My daughter loves the dancing robin that appears here periodically.  You don't find a dancing robin just anywhere.

I5oP3cWF6pf7uaRS6Vw25A.text: My Partner In Cuisine and I do our best to avoid corporate food, but him being a burger expert (i.e. snob) I convinced him to give the place a go.  I had been there on numerous occasions and enjoyed their variety of burgers and unlimited steak fries.  Unfortunately, I suffered a rather embarrassing moment when we were told that the kitchen will not cook a burger rare.  I know better than to ever suggest a corporate restaurant to the PIC again!    Despite this, we had some decent service and our burgers were pretty good.  After much discussion, we determined that it's not really the burgers that makes Red Robin good, it's the toppings.  Simply said, the meat can't stand alone.  Without being slathered in cheese, jalapenos, barbecue sauce, or whatever, the burgers are nothing more than overcooked hockey pucks.    Would I eat there again?  It's likely I would go with someone who has less discriminating taste buds.  Would I take PIC?  Hell no!

TWzbF2TIT5d9glgzVHWuWw.text: I enjoyed a dinner out at the Waterfront Red Robin. I ordered the bacon cheeseburger which was okay, not great. What I really found disappointing was the chicken tortilla soup.  It seems that at a restaurant that has this soup is either really good or really bad. There is no in between.   The service was great and the atmosphere was fun. I would very likely return to this Red Robin.

WcJuHpxoTBupyG7H41O9Dw.text: It's a Red Robin...typical chain restaurant.  On a Saturday night in the Waterfront area, this was the only restaurant with less than a 2 hour wait.  I was a bit weary of that fact, but we were seated within 20 min and the service was great.   They just added a few menu items and their happy hour prices are CHEAP!!!!  I loved the new shrimp taco's and with a Blue Moon - I was happy!

9sy8Je_yyq8mofaD5ON_RQ.text: Went here for lunch today.   What we sampled:  The Onion Ring Tower (delicious I really liked the campfire sauce)  Prime Chophouse Burger (decent, but overall meh as yelp would put it) Steak Fries (I usually hate steak fries to I will say these were great)   Overall it was decent for lunch, but I don't love chains so I would rather go somewhere else.

Swl1mDU2ZgF5P0GLxUiiSQ.text: Red tavern burger and bottomless fries with a side of ranch, tavern sauce and $3 drafts please! only thing I would recommend is cleaner bathroom I've been there during the week and on the weekends too and every time the bathroom is horrendous!

fbSQnDPdKmEbStCSAvjh5g.text: Service (5/5) Our waitress was this really nice older lady with red/purple hair! She actually made the experience better. She was very talkative and gave some great suggestions. She was super honest which I appreciated because most waiters say they "love" everything on the menu.   Food (4/5) The avocado burger was good but it wasn't the best burger I ever had. It had this hint of spice that I really liked.   I would probably go back but I would get the hot wings instead.

l2iYdAyMEAiSckiLYpTa4w.text: I'm a fan of Red Robin's food. I like their sandwiches and bottomless fries. However, this location needs work in costumer service and management. I've been to this location twice. The first time, I went with someone during the late afternoon/early evening on a weekday. It was not very busy, but it took awhile for someone to take our orders. And then we waited about 15 minutes for our margaritas. We got our food and wanted to order more fries since there were probably only 8 fries on our plates, but our server was nowhere to be found. We later realized that he was both the bartender and the server. Not very practical or efficient. When he finally came to our table and we ordered more, he disappeared for a long while again to make drinks for the people at the bar. There were other servers, so I'm unsure why he was bartending AND waiting tables. Anyway, when he did bring out more fries, there were only 6 fries. Yeah, some "bottomless"... We ordered more, and after another round of waiting and waiting, another 6 fries came out. Other Red Robins have not been so stingy with their fries, especially if the server is going to disappear for long periods of time and not check on you.  We went again on a Saturday night, so we expected it to be busy. But to wait 45 minutes for two sandwiches is ridiculous. Also, we didn't have any silverware for my friend to eat his starter salad, and we rarely saw our server, so we had to wait about 10 minutes after the salad arrived to ask her for a fork. And when we later ordered more fries, our server was extremely rude, almost as if we were inconveniencing her. When I asked her for more, she just sighed and walked away. After a few minutes, she came back and said, "I put the order in but it's going to take five minutes to cook. Are you SURE you still want them?" It's strange that she didn't have time to check on us for refills on drinks, silverware, or ask how our food was, but she sure made time to stop at our table and suggest that we should cancel our second basket of fries because it needs to be cooked!  I've been to other Red Robin locations and they have been great. But I won't be back to this one.

IIEM13c3t9M0K7QYaUMaEg.text: After our last visit to Red Robin on January 4th, I am updating my review. This was the Red Robin that we are used to eating at. The food was great and Shelley was a fantastic server.

DopTe3O8lQLUozyRC_salw.text: Not too bad; I'd say its geared more towards kids, though.  PROS:   Great Staff at all locations, every time that we've gone. Food is okay (not awesome, but good) Endless fries are always a win! Unique atmosphere, sort of retro diner-esque.  CONS: It is just sandwiches, but really that's what the restaurant is (to call it a "con" is debatable and sort of unfair).  Not sure if this is a pro or con, but its very kid-friendly and kid-oriented, IMO  The "salmon" burger was good (its actually pieces of salmon filet (not ground salmon patties), and I ordered some teriyaki sauce on the side--it was pretty darn tasty! The Roast Beef au jus Sandwich was pretty good too--loads of meat!

c7I9N3lpbvAfl7Wknqq2bA.text: I can't imagine anyone rating this 5 stars.  Three maybe but five? This is a chain burger joint - and the burgers are about 10 bucks.  The staff was attentive.  The food not terrible. And they have "endless" fries. If you need to watch the calories -- watch out here.  They put mayo or some other sauce on all the burgers.  Probably good for families with kids - if you have the $$$$.

M3misu4c5pjSVcyzZ80dYA.text: I go there all the time and am addicted to their wings.  The good: - They have the best burgers bar none. -  Their appetizers are really good. I think they have the best wings in the world and you can have a lot of fun with their onion rings and other stuff. - Endless fries - It usually is pretty fast.  - They usually make it up to you if they screw up.  The bad: - Due to their location they usually attract families with kids screaming at the top of their lungs. The parents all find the screaming to be "cute" of course and won't dare stop their precious little angels from ruining your dinner. Stay far away from any of the tables that seat 6 people or more. - They used to have problems with running out of french fries and taking forever to make burgers, even though burgers were the only things they made. They have been much better lately though. - No sliders. Why? Who knows. - If you order the short stack of onion rings, you get the smaller end. So, you get maybe 2-3 full size onion rings instead of the 6 you should be getting. - Their television's are not well placed. They either require neck pain to watch or aren't possible to watch at all.

tsoh2cFviCJaw8NOQPuBwg.text: OMG, I love Red Robin!  I'm usually not very into chain restaurants and I prefer to eat at small local businesses, but I was so happy when I moved here and saw that there's a Red Robin!  I'm a vegetarian, and they substitute boca burgers on any of their burgers. The 'shroom burger is awesome! My roommate loves the Whisky River BBQ burger.  We crave it. We're junkies. We constantly talk about how we need to get our next fix, nahhh.

XdstT8XVn-5Fxq9tCCHEWw.text: Bottomless Freckled Lemonade! Free refills! Must get every time you go!  The place gets packed on a weekend. Their Royal Red Robin burger is definitely one of my favorite. Burger with fried egg! If you love guacamole, get their Guacamole burger. I love this place because you can basically make your own burgers! You can add guac to your royal red robin or you can add fried egg to your guac burger!  Oh, their fries are awesome! Use the seasoning they provide to add some taste. The fries are bottomless as well!  And they serve you the burger with half of it wrapped already. It's clean and easy to eat (especially if you are one of those that's too lazy to wash your hands).

aReVgtMt3WKF5I25N81PFA.text: What I like about Red Robin is that it's consistent. I love the unlimited strawberry lemonade and french fries. They have recently added certain new burgers and it seems they're trying to bring more people in. That's fine and the burger was just average. The beers are typically domestic and there's not a ton of variety. They have lots of frou frou drinks if you like that sort of thing and it's good for kids, including a kid menu and balloons. This location is just ok, but also gets really busy since it's next to the move theatre.

nXgwB_yyXpqe87HrDPzHyQ.text: They were really crowded, but we still got seated in a little under the 10 mins wait they said we'd have.  The waitress was really good, kept checking up on us (despite how busy they were), refilled our drinks multiple times, etc.   Been here 8-10 times over the last 2 years or so, plan to keep returning.

vedUdLAR02qnLcZmClfCqw.text: The times I have been here I was impressed at the food and service in comparison to a Red Robin I had visited several years ago. We were seated quickly and taken care of by the wait staff.  I had the Prime Chophouse Burger and the Burnin' Love Burger on two separate occasions. My food came out hot, fresh, and cooked to my liking. The fries were all newly made.   Because it is a chain, you know going in that you won't be gettin extravagant food, but for a burger & fries kind of meal there are a lot of choices, many of which are good.

wCdI2sODOe3ijqLgdjPDDA.text: Not impressed. in all fairness, i didn't get a burger, because i had just had one that day and it wasnt my choice to go there.. i had ava"cobb"o salad, my wife had a bbq grilled chicken sand, and my daughter had a turkey burger. all of which were pretty bad. my salad was very soggy, there was about and 8th of an avacado on it, and it was just all around bad. the chicken sandwich was dry, the breast needed pounded a little before grilling because it was huge in the middle and thin on the ends.. bland. the bbq sauce was good at least! the onion straws were soggy and sooo salty. horrible. the turkey burger was the worst by far. i mean i dont even know what they did to make it so disgusting but it was absolutely nasty. i remember going here 5 or so years ago and thinking the burgers were pretty good, so i would suggest getting a burger. dont you dare get anything else! service was pretty good at least.. drinks are good too.. if you could give a place 2.5 stars id go with that.. and for the guy that says the turkey burgers are good, dont take his word for it, a lot of people think edible=good

wzLG3gymLdNPL_FPs1GwTA.text: Red Robin likes to portray itself as a casual dining family restaurant, but don't be fooled- the food is just as bad for you as any "Super Size Me" fast food joint. Disappointingly, there are virtually no healthy meal options at Red Robin, unlike many of its competitors.  Burgers and salads all run around 1000+ Calories by default, NOT COUNTING the "bottomless fries" that are included with many meals. You can mitigate the damage, though. Be prepared to ask for no mayo or sauce if you order a burger, and be prepared to ask for the dressing on the side if you order a salad.
